simplesect.title: Using the New Connection wizard
simplesect.para: To create a new connection please use the New Connection wizard.

simplesect.title: Duplicating an existing connection
simplesect.para:
It is also possible to duplicate an existing connection. This is helpful if the new connection has similar connection parameters:
Select the connection you want to duplicate and select
Copy Connection from context menu or use the StrgC shortcut.
Afterward select
Paste Connection from context menu or use the StrgV shortcut. Observe the new connection, prefixed with "Copy of ".
Rename the connection to your needs.
Modify the connection parameters to your needs.

section.title: Modifying connection parameters
section.para: The connection parameters could be modified in the Connection properties. Select a connection and choose Properties... from context menu or press AltEnter to open the properties dialog.
Note: A connection must be closed in order to modify its connection parameters.

section.title: Renaming a connection
section.para: To rename a connection select a connection and choose Rename Connection... from context menu or press F2.
In the opened dialog enter the new name and press OK.

section.title: Deleting a connection
section.para:
To delete a connection select a connection and choose
Delete Connection from context menu or press Delete.
Note: A connection must be closed in order to delete it.

section.title: Opening a connection
section.para: A connection is automatically opened when expanding the DIT or when performing a search.

To open a connection explicitely choose one of the following options:
In the Connections view select a connection and choose
Open Connection from context menu or from toolbar.
Double-click a connection.

section.title: Closing a connection
section.para:
To close a connection select a connection and choose
Close Connection from context menu or from toolbar.

section.title: Enabling secure connections
section.para: Apache Directory Studio supports secure connections using SSL (ldaps) or StartTLS extended operation. Select a proper encryption method in the Connection properties.

section.title: Sharing connections
section.para: There are two ways to export and import connections. This may be useful if you want to copy your connections from one computer to another or if you want to share connection parameters with other users. You could also use this features to backup your defined connections.

simplesect.title: Import/Export connections
simplesect.para: You could use the Export Connection wizard and Import Connection wizard to export and import connections.

simplesect.title: Copy/Paste connections as LDAP URL
simplesect.para: A more simple way is to copy/paste connections as LDAP URL.
RFC 2255 specifies the LDAP URL format. Apache Directory Studio uses the host and port field and uses X- extensions for all other connection paramter.

row.entry: Any name, must be URL encoded
Simple imf X-BIND-USER is present, else Anonymous
Any DN, must be URL encoded
A valid base DN, none to get base DNs from the Root DSE
A positive integer, 0 for no count limit
A positive integer, 0 for no time limit
If present the subentries control is activated.
If present the paged control is activated.
If present the scroll mode is activated.

simplesect.para: Here's an example how such an URL looks like: ldap://localhost:10389/????X-CONNECTION-NAME=ApacheDS,X-BIND-USER=uid=admin%2cou=system,X-BIND-PASSWORD=secret,X-COUNT-LIMIT=1000
When you copy a connection within the Connections view it is copied in the described format to your clipboard. You could then paste this LDAP URL into a text editor or to an email.
The same way you could copy an LDAP URL from somewhere and paste it into the Connections view.

section.title: Handling large number of entries
section.para: A directory may have entries with thousands of child entries. It is not recommended to fetch all these children when browsing because this increases directory and network load and is very time consuming.

simplesect.title: Limiting number of fetched entries
simplesect.para: It is recommended to limit the number of returned entries. The limit is defined in Connection properties.

simplesect.title: Filtering children
simplesect.para:
Another option is to use a filter to limit the fetched children. Choose
Filter Children... from context menu. In the opened dialog you could define a LDAP filter. Hit StrgSpace to get content assistance. The drop-down list provides a history of recently used filters. A click to the
Filter Editor
button opens the Filter Editor dialog.

section.title: Showing RootDSE and Schema entry
section.para: To make RootDSE and Schema entry visible in the Browser view enable Show Directory Metadata in the Browser's drop down menu.

section.title: Showing subentries
section.para: Subentries are a special kind of entries used for managing the administration of different aspects of the directory. By default they are not visible. To make them visible in the Browser view enable Fetch subentries in the Connection properties.

section.title: Displaying entry's attribute
section.para: Select an entry in the Browser view. The Entry editor will be opened and shows the entry's attributes.

section.title: Filtering entry's attribute
section.para:
Please see
Quick Filter
in Entry editor features.

section.title: Creating an entry
section.para: To create a new entry please use the New Entry wizard.

section.title: Renaming an entry
section.para: To rename an entry please use the Rename Entry dialog.

section.title: Moving entries
section.para: To move entries to another parent please use the Move Entry dialog.

section.title: Deleting entries
section.para:
To delete entries select the entries you would like to delete and choose
Delete from context menu or press Delete key.

listitem.para: Use the Attribute wizard to specify the attribute.
After finishing the wizard a proper Value editor is invoked. Enter the value and press Enter.
Select the attribute where you would like to add a value.

Choose
New Value from tool bar or context menu or hit
Strg + . This invokes a proper Value editor
Enter the value and press Enter.
Select the value you would like to edit.
Invoke the default Value editor by pressing Enter or F7 or double-click the value.
Invoke a custom Value editor by choosing one from Edit Value With in the context menu.
Modify the value and press Enter.

section.title: Deleting attributes and values
section.para:
To delete attributes and values select the attributes and values you would like to delete and choose
Delete from tool bar or context menu or press Delete key.

section.title: Modifying the object class
section.para: To modify the object class please use the Edit Entry wizard.
